original_title: Surrender! The Sudden Death of Alvira, Pennsylvania
overview: After its shutdown in January 1944, the former Pennsylvania Ordnance Works served as a storage depot for bombs and artillery, and a top-secret testing area for Army and Navy weapons projects,  Ultimately, the much-abused facility's 8400 acres and upkeep became an albatross, and it was deactivated December 1950 and sold piecemeal.
tagline: In the early Spring of 1942, the peaceful lives would change... forever.
title: Surrender! The Sudden Death of Alvira, Pennsylvania
